result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Syris Thomas Birkley

records.addlTxt: Court in receipt of a letter from examining psychologist requesting an extension due to needing additional time to complete the competency examination. Court notified the State and received approval to reschedule. Return on Doctor's report rescheduled for December 9th, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Received and Filed. Competency Evaluation Extension Ltr
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

DUE TO TECHNICAL ISSUES, THIS HEARING WAS HELD OFF THE RECORD. THIS IS NOT THE OFFICIAL RECORD. Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Jane Jerman appeared by video as a friend of the court. Prosecuting attorney Mallory R Davis appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to go Pro Se. For reasons stated off the record court raises competency. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
